intro: Aetheocephalus thorelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with leaves that are heart-shaped and often marked with silver or white veins. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Aetheocephalus thorelii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
